x 5 row in half_double_crochet single_crochet single_crochet half_double_crochet half_double_crochet finished sizes hdc2tog half_double_crochet 2 st together toe to heel s - 21 5cm / m - 23cm / l - 24cm pattern notes the chain stitches at the beginning of each row/round do not count as a stitch the last stitch of each round is attached to the first stitch of the round with a slip_stitch do not turn your work unless stated otherwise please be cautious wearing your socks on hard floors they are slippery i used 120g katia azteca for a pair in size s azteca = 100g/180m p skein is the © yarn answer 2020 page 1 of 2 toe & forefoot section start with a magic_ring round 1 chain 1 work 10 half_double_crochet into the magic_ring pull tight 10 round 2 chain 1 2 half_double_crochet in each st around 20 round 3 chain 1 *2 half_double_crochet half_double_crochet repeat from * around 30 round 4 chain 1 *half_double_crochet in the first st half_double_crochet in the 3rd loop of the next st repeat from * around 30 round 5 chain 1 *half_double_crochet in the 3rd loop of the first st half_double_crochet in the next st repeat from * around 30 s round 6-18 repeat round 4 even rounds and round 5 odd rounds m round 6-20 repeat round 4 even rounds and round 5 odd rounds l round 6-22 repeat round 4 even rounds and round 5 odd rounds ** this section of the slipper should cover the top of your foot up to your ankle it is best if it has to stretch just a little bit to do so ** heel section you will now start working back and forth in row row 1-7 chain 1 half_double_crochet in 20 sts 20 turn row 8 chain 1 hdc2tog across 10 turn row 9 chain 1 hdc2tog across 5 turn row 10 chain 1 hdc2tog half_double_crochet hdc2tog 3 turn **do not cut your yarn you will now be working in rounds around the ankle portion of the slipper** ankle section from here go back to working in rounds round 1 chain 1 single_crochet evenly around the ankle opening so that you ll have 32 stitches around 32 round 2
